blog.name: nicolenostalgia
blog.title: tell my story
blog.description: I'm just a 22 year old who's a little too obsessed with musicals // queer // she/her// Art Blog // my Hamilton fic's side blog // Eliza Rp Blog // Laurens Rp Blog // Angelica Rp Blog // Multimuse Rp Blog // Support Me on Ko-fi

summary: y’know, I’m not gonna lie, I’ve never seen a video by Dan (or Phil, for that matter) until just now. Don’t get me wrong, I’ve...
body:
y’know, I’m not gonna lie, I’ve never seen a video by Dan (or Phil, for that matter) until just now. Don’t get me wrong, I’ve seen them briefly in other people’s videos, heard lots about them, etc, etc. And it wasn’t like I didn’t watch them for any particular reason—I’m just a lazy shit who looks at new channels I should check out and pushes them into the “I’ll do that later but actually not” part of my brain permanently. I knew they were good people and funny, but I just never got around to it

ANYWAY, I’m getting to Dan’s most recent video of course. Let’s not play games: I watched it because I’m queer and anytime I see youtubers or celebrities coming out that I know of, I’m excited. I’m always highkey proud of people who are in the “spotlight” and still find the courage to come out. 

And holy shit. I say “holy shit” because no, I didn’t relate to all of it, but a lot of it? Yeah. I was especially shocked by the acknowledgment of emo culture being this sorta queer-friendly place that felt, however briefly, comforting because like… I’ve been there. I had an emo phase right in the middle of finding out I was queer, going through severe depression, anxiety, and tons of other shit. I had emo friends who were, admittedly, friends-you-hang-out-with-at-school-and-maybe-went-somewhere-with-once-but-actually-aren’t-close-to… but we were almost all queer. Those who weren’t were accepting. Most of us had mental illness or something going on in our lives. It was this briefly safe place in a sea of danger, especially as someone growing up in the rural south.

It was that and Dan talking about how confusing sexuality is because like. Yeah. I identify primarily with the label queer because nothing fits. I’m fine with people using gay and, yeah, irl I usually start with just calling myself gay because it’s easier than having to explain, but idk. There’s something strangely empowering about hearing someone with such a large following use the word queer because he also doesn’t fit perfectly into another label. I spend so much time wondering when I’ll finally “figure out my real label” because I want a label because labels feel neat and tidy and easy. But “queer” is a perfectly acceptable label and I think I needed that reminder.

I’m in a place where I love myself and my queerness, but I still needed to hear that. And even more so, there were definitely people still going through the wringer who needed to hear it desperately.

I don’t have any nice wrap up to this post. I guess I just wanted to talk about it. He’s been through a lot and I’m glad he’s in a place where he felt he could make the video and come out to family/friends. And yes, if anyone’s wondering, I really liked his humor and how genuine he is, so I am gonna check out some other videos lmao

blog.name: tea-confessions
blog.title: Tea Time All the Time
blog.description: Have any burning confessions about YouTubers, content influencers, or anything like that you want to put out for the world to see? Send them in here where we can hopefully have an open discussion where your opinions can be shared in a safe space talked about freely. Please be respectful when sharing opinions or reblogging. Also if you want, I can post your confessions with out any comments being added from me, just mark as **No Response Pls**

body:
Welcome one and all!

So I have been thinking for a while about opening an account like this where people could come and send in their thoughts, opinions, and discussions about how we feel about different people in the social stream, mainly focusing on YouTubers. I expect many much tea to be spilled and understand feeling might get hurt here so that’s why I make this post to say that I just hope we can be respectful here and have a good time getting some thoughts out there in a safe space.

I will also say that I will be posting my own things often and encourage people to send your own in. Hell if you want to send it in and ask me not to comment on it, I will happily do that too. I will always read them first to make sure they don’t break any rules for courtesy sakes but will post after that and will comment if you want.

I hope to have this place be popping so that people can start discussions and maybe just get thoughts out there without fear of how people will react. Here’s to fun and tea spilling!

—DD

blog.name: cosmichorror-yt
blog.title: Cosmic Horror
blog.description: Cosmic Horror is a Youtube channel of two content creators Matt & Seth who are dedicated to producing videos relating to horror (of any kind).

summary: You can now become a member!
title: You can now become a member!
body:
A new feature Youtube implemented a while ago, the new join button. Since for the most part, Youtube fails to pay their content creators sufficiently through ad revenue, this is the alternative option for us.

~ Join the Cosmic Horror Membership Program ~

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjm3LKUCB5u2VgYDoayTm4w/join

Hello to all horror fanatics. Here is my new offering to all of you, which is a new feature Youtube implemented a while ago, the new join button. Since for the most part, Youtube fails to pay their content creators sufficiently through ad revenue, this is the alternative option for us.

- It is not just the badges and emoji’s for a reward for donating to us monthly, I would never myself donate monthly for that either. I’m trying to imagine something I would be willing to spend $5 a month on and then create these exclusive videos with that in mind.

- I’ve been working on some member-exclusive content for this new join feature already, trying to utilize it as best as I can. In-depth analysis videos of various horror games like Amnesia, Lost in Vivo, Silent Hill, etc.

- Please don’t imagine what you’ve already have been seeing. These videos will be a little different and I’m going to spend much more time on these than the usual content you would see on the channel, to up the production value a notch. I’m trying to feature in more gameplay between the narrations, make the videos feel more involving, immersive and engaging as well.

- You’ll also have access to whatever new free-to-use horror soundtracks I create through all my audio software (Audacity + FL Studio usually), so horror game developers lacking music should be pumped! I really have fun creating these tracks and have been trying really hard improving on my skills over time. My favorite type of music to create are psychological (mainly modern horror tracks) that take inspiration from games like the original Resident Evil games and Silent Hill, so expect that mainly.

- Behind the scenes, content is something I COULD do, but it’s up to the fans if that sounds interesting enough.

- The first video I already uploaded is a prototype for the Metus soundtrack (our horror game mod for Amnesia). A few tracks were cut from the game that is also available for download to be used for your own game/mod/custom story. - As of now, I’m working on a Dev Diary for Metus, sort of like Amnesia - The Dark Descent’s commentary option where you can learn more about how the game was developed over time.

- I’ve been watching some really interesting documentaries and writing down notes and implementing the elements little by little as I work on these new videos.

- Even if you do not join Cosmic Horror as a member, normal content will not stop and simply watching us supports the channel and we’re greatly thankful for that!

- Matt﻿

~ Join the Cosmic Horror Membership Program ~

- You’ll also have access to whatever new free-to-use horror soundtracks I create through all my audio software (Audacity + FL Studio usually), so horror game developers lacking music should be pumped! I really have fun creating these tracks and have been trying really hard improving on my skills over time. My favorite type of music to create are psychological (mainly modern horror tracks) that take inspiration from games like the original Resident Evil games and Silent Hill, so expect that mainly.

- Behind the scenes, content is something I COULD do, but it’s up to the fans if that sounds interesting enough.

- The first video I already uploaded is a prototype for the Metus soundtrack (our horror game mod for Amnesia). A few tracks were cut from the game that is also available for download to be used for your own game/mod/custom story. - As of now, I’m working on a Dev Diary for Metus, sort of like Amnesia - The Dark Descent’s commentary option where you can learn more about how the game was developed over time.

- I’ve been watching some really interesting documentaries and writing down notes and implementing the elements little by little as I work on these new videos.

- Even if you do not join Cosmic Horror as a member, normal content will not stop and simply watching us supports the channel and we’re greatly thankful for that!

- Matt﻿
trail.content:
A new feature Youtube implemented a while ago, the new join button. Since for the most part, Youtube fails to pay their content creators sufficiently through ad revenue, this is the alternative option for us.

~ Join the Cosmic Horror Membership Program ~

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjm3LKUCB5u2VgYDoayTm4w/join

Hello to all horror fanatics. Here is my new offering to all of you, which is a new feature Youtube implemented a while ago, the new join button. Since for the most part, Youtube fails to pay their content creators sufficiently through ad revenue, this is the alternative option for us.

- It is not just the badges and emoji’s for a reward for donating to us monthly, I would never myself donate monthly for that either. I’m trying to imagine something I would be willing to spend $5 a month on and then create these exclusive videos with that in mind.

- I’ve been working on some member-exclusive content for this new join feature already, trying to utilize it as best as I can. In-depth analysis videos of various horror games like Amnesia, Lost in Vivo, Silent Hill, etc.

- Please don’t imagine what you’ve already have been seeing. These videos will be a little different and I’m going to spend much more time on these than the usual content you would see on the channel, to up the production value a notch. I’m trying to feature in more gameplay between the narrations, make the videos feel more involving, immersive and engaging as well.

- You’ll also have access to whatever new free-to-use horror soundtracks I create through all my audio software (Audacity + FL Studio usually), so horror game developers lacking music should be pumped! I really have fun creating these tracks and have been trying really hard improving on my skills over time. My favorite type of music to create are psychological (mainly modern horror tracks) that take inspiration from games like the original Resident Evil games and Silent Hill, so expect that mainly.

- Behind the scenes, content is something I COULD do, but it’s up to the fans if that sounds interesting enough.

- The first video I already uploaded is a prototype for the Metus soundtrack (our horror game mod for Amnesia). A few tracks were cut from the game that is also available for download to be used for your own game/mod/custom story. - As of now, I’m working on a Dev Diary for Metus, sort of like Amnesia - The Dark Descent’s commentary option where you can learn more about how the game was developed over time.

- I’ve been watching some really interesting documentaries and writing down notes and implementing the elements little by little as I work on these new videos.

- Even if you do not join Cosmic Horror as a member, normal content will not stop and simply watching us supports the channel and we’re greatly thankful for that!

- Matt﻿

A new feature Youtube implemented a while ago, the new join button. Since for the most part, Youtube fails to pay their content creators sufficiently through ad revenue, this is the alternative option for us.

~ Join the Cosmic Horror Membership Program ~

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjm3LKUCB5u2VgYDoayTm4w/join

tags: okay time to take a nap i was going to earlier but then he dropped this
i genuinely cried so many times for so many reasons
summary: y’all i’m crying i love dan so much and i’m so fucking proud of him for this. i’ve been watching him since 2012, when i was 17...
body: y’all i’m crying i love dan so much and i’m so fucking proud of him for this. i’ve been watching him since 2012, when i was 17 and wasn’t even accepting my own sexuality. and now to see him lay himself out like this on the internet and talk about his own sexuality story. i’m just… he continues to impress me and make my love grow more as he lets me and so many others know we’re not alone in so many aspects
